titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Southern Poverty Law Center Intelligence Project Collection, 1940s-2020; 1940s-ongoing RL.10135
titlestmt.author: Rubenstein Library Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-06-30 09:10:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Southern Poverty Law Center Intelligence Project collection
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The SPLC Intelligence Project Collection includes printed materials, serials, organizational literature, pamphlets, clippings, catalogs, fliers, and correspondence from a variety of groups monitored by the SPLC and its contacts between the 1980s and 2010. Included within the collection are many groups falling within the SPLC Klanwatch and Militia Watch projects. Organizations represented in this collection typically promoted anti-semitic, white supremacist, racist, separatist, or anti-Communist views and policies. Other organizations promoted Second Amendment rights, right-wing Christian and American nationalism, Y2K and survivalist preparations, and the rise of the Confederacy. SPLC's interests expanded across the political spectrum to include both right-wing and left-wing extremist literature.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Southern Poverty Law Center Intelligence Project Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is divided into two series: Organizations and SPLC Research, Subjects, and Clippings Files. There are also over 450 serial titles which have been separated from the collection and are available for request through the library catalog.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Over 450 serial titles have been cataloged separately from this archival collection. Click this link for a list of SPLC Intelligence Project serials in the library catalog: Separately cataloged serials

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The SPLC Intelligence Project Collection includes printed materials, serials, organizational literature, pamphlets, clippings, catalogs, fliers, and correspondence from a variety of groups monitored by the SPLC and its contacts between the 1980s and 2010. Included within the collection are many groups falling within the SPLC Klanwatch and Militia Watch projects. Organizations represented in this collection typically promoted anti-Semitic, white supremacist, racist, separatist, or anti-Communist views and politics. Other organizations promoted Second Amendment rights, right-wing Christian and American nationalism, Y2K and survivalist preparations, and the rise of the Confederacy. SPLC's interests expanded across the political spectrum to include both right-wing and left-wing extremist literature.

The manuscript portion of the collection includes 11.0 lin. ft. of materials; the remainder of the collection, consisting of serials collected by SPLC from various organizations, has been separated for individual cataloging.
Check the library catalog link for a list of separated serial titles: Separately cataloged serials

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Southern Poverty Law Center is based in Montgomery, Alabama.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Southern Poverty Law Center Intelligence Project Collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by: Rubenstein Library Staff, March 2014
Web content described by Michelle Runyon, May 2020.
Accessions described in this finding aid: 2013-0048

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Evelyn Rich Papers and the Ku Klux Klan Collection, held in Rubenstein Library.

controlaccess.corpname: Invisible Empire, Knights of the Ku Klux Klan (1975)
Knights of the Ku Klux Klan (1975)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes materials collected from different groups and organizations monitored by the SPLC Intelligence Project. It has been arranged into subseries by creating organization; within each subseries, materials range from catalogs and ephemeral mailings to pamphlets or publications by the group. Only scattered serials are present in this collection. For information about other serials published by monitored groups and collected by SPLC, consult the library's online catalog.

did.unittitle: Confederate Knights of the Ku Klux Klan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes articles and pamphlets by Col. Jack Mohr. Mohr's organization is also referred to as Crusades for Christ, and he published in both Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, and Little Rock, Arkansas. Titles in this folder include "The Marvelous Epistle of Romans," "This Time Bomb Called Zionism," "From the Watchman's Corner!," and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes booklets and pamphlets by Jack Mohr, such as "Seed of Satan: Literal or Figurative?," "The Birthright or the Right to Govern," "Signs and Wonders!," "Firearms and Freedom!," "Conspiracy to Deceive the Elect!!," "A Warning Direct from the Horse's Mouth!," "Exploding the 'Chosen People' Myth," "The Psychopolitical Indoctrination of America!," "Battle for the Truth," "Salt Without Savor!" and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "CSA" refers to "The Covenant, the Sword, the Arm of the Lord." File includes photocopied literature such as the Christian Army Basic Training Manual and "Prepare War" pamphlet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Library of Political Secrets booklets: "The Secret Driving Force of Communism," "What is Judaism?".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "The Seven Year Tribulation of Daniel and Revelation," with other pamphlets and fliers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Essays and reports, including "Germany: Hotbed of the Mafia," "The Talmud: Bible of the So-Called Jews," "The Myth of a White Jewish Race," and some excerpts from The Talon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "America: Superpower of Prophecy" and "A Time for Joy."

scopecontent.p: Flier announcing and explaining the organization.

scopecontent.p: Article mentioning FAIR collected by SPLC.

did.unittitle: White Camelia Knights of the Ku Klux Klan
SPLC Research, Subjects, Clippings, and Web Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: SPLC subscribed to clippings services to monitor news coverage of accusations of bias, hate crimes, Klan and Nazi activities, and mentions of other extremist groups. Clippings collected are from local and regional publications and do not include national press stories from AP or other syndicates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings about various hate groups, racial discord, and coverage of SPLC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes various clippings, handouts, and fliers from neo-Nazis, Klan groups, and white power groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes literature on anti-tax movements, anti-UN movements, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes literature by pro-white Christian extremists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Majority of materials are anti-Black/anti-African American.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mass mailings from Thorz Hammer promoting his book "WHAM! Confessions of a White American Man."
